#Text=Advertise a Home Daycare Program
#Text=Advertising a home daycare program could require you do so by building trust .
#Text=If you are just starting your own in-home daycare , you could look forward to building your customer base .
#Text=If the daycare is already set up and running , you may have some clients already .
#Text=In this case you may expand and make a bigger profit and a stronger customer base .
#Text=Advertising for your home daycare program is the best way to improve your business , and the following steps will help you make the most of advertising it .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Networking
#Text=Ask your family and friends .
#Text=If you do not have a daycare started yet , but are looking to open one in your home , you still have contacts you can use : your family and friends .
#Text=They can spread the word about your services just as customers and employees can .
#Text=Get your employees to do outreach .
#Text=Have your employees find new customers to their relatives , neighbors and friends .
#Text=They will highlight all the helpful details of your daycare program and do the needful .
#Text=You may give them an incentive on each admission .
#Text=Use your present customers .
#Text=If you already have a daycare business program , you already have a network of great advertisers at your disposal : your customers !
#Text=Parents are the easiest and best way to get word out about your services .
#Text=They see your quality of care firsthand , and will give honest appraisals to friends and relatives who need childcare services .
#Text=If you have a good relationship with the parents , they are often willing to take home a flyer or information packet for your daycare to show people they know .
#Text=These connections can help bring in more customers .
#Text=Stay in contact with your clients and keep them informed of any activities happening in the home daycare program .
#Text=Use the Media to Advertise
#Text=Make a website .
#Text=You could make a paid or a free website to promote and build market value for you home daycare program .
#Text=This will help people to have something to refer first .
#Text=You may How to Advertise Your Home Business Online and see the admissions increase .
#Text=You may highlight how your home daycare program is safe and considerate of the child 's needs .
#Text=You may build trust by adding various details to create interest in the parents .
#Text=Customer testimonials .
#Text=Pictures of the activities the kids get to do in the daycare .
#Text=Their safety measures .
#Text=Various facilities available in your home daycare program .
#Text=The staff credentials .
#Text=Your achievements and other great details .
#Text=Harness the power of social media .
#Text=Social media is another easy , free source of advertising your home daycare program .

#Text=You can post pictures ( with parental consent ) of the children you already work with as they play games , celebrate birthdays , and create crafts in order to show ( rather than tell ) how you take care of children .
#Text=Creating a page on Facebook , Twitter or any other any social media can be used to get the word out to the parents .
#Text=Take out ads .
#Text=Classifieds in newspapers or school district newsletters can get the word to customers you may not otherwise be connected to ( such as through friends or family , or social media ) .
#Text=They do cost money , often per word , but the investment is worth it if you find even just a few loyal and long-time customers willing to pay you to watch their children .
#Text=If you have your own computer and printer , and access to Microsoft Publisher or if you are very creative yourself , you may buy copy paper and create your own flyers .
#Text=You can do the design , the wording , and the placement of the flyers .
#Text=Libraries , town halls , and colleges are just a few of the dozens of free places you can distribute them at .
#Text=Welcoming clients .

#Text=Once you start getting a positive response from potential clients , you must build a rapport with a the customers to as to have them come again and opt for your daycare program over the others .
#Text=Being helpful , pleasant and supportive of their child 's needs will go a long way .
#Text=Be prompt and proactive with the clients concerns and queries to improve the service quality of your home daycare program .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Safety is a big consideration for families looking for a childcare provider .
#Text=Make sure that your home daycare is a place where you would consider sending your own child .
#Text=If you have any special certifications , such as an Early Education degree , or state/Department of Public Welfare certifications , make sure to mention these in your advertisement .
#Text=Experience as a nanny or babysitter is a plus as well , especially if you are just starting out .
#Text=Warning
#Text=You may get irate customers too .
#Text=Be prepared and ready with your answers so you speak responsibly .
